wiki.summary: On the album’s first song, 21 Savage raps about how he frightens his enemies. They start running away when Savage is around because they know that he won’t spare them. Savage also juxtaposes running with several other common usages. Elsewhere, Savage reminisces about his career and recollects his mindset when the first Savage Mode was released. Metro Boomin initiates the record with a frenetic, menacing beat that samples Diana Ross’ February 1976 song, “I Thought It Took a Little Time.” Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: On the album’s first song, 21 Savage raps about how he frightens his enemies. They start running away when Savage is around because they know that he won’t spare them. Savage also juxtaposes running with several other common usages. Elsewhere, Savage reminisces about his career and recollects his mindset when the first Savage Mode was released. Metro Boomin initiates the record with a frenetic, menacing beat that samples Diana Ross’ February 1976 song, “I Thought It Took a Little Time.” The official music video was premiered about fifteen hours after the album’s worldwide release. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
